title: Pierrot le fou
description:
Pierrot le fou
 <a href="
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0059592/" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0059592/</a>

Released in 1965, Jean-Luc Godard&#039;s &#039;Pierrot Le Fou&#039; was his tenth feature film in only six years, and for many represents a career highpoint.

Loosely based on Lionel White&#039;s novel &#039;Obsession&#039;, Godard uses the story (a man fed up with his materialistic life runs off with his child&#039;s babysitter and chaos ensues) as a framework to incorporate many elements of his personal philosophies, as well as ideas and techniques already introduced in previous films. The presence of Jean-Paul Belmondo on the run evokes &#039;A bout de souffle&#039;, and the stunning widescreen cinematography recalls &#039;Le Mepris&#039;.
